verb.description: Publicly display (a work of art or item of interest) in an art gallery or museum or at a trade fair.
examples: only one sculpture was exhibited in the artist's lifetime

verb.description: Manifest or deliberately display (a quality or a type of behavior)
examples: he could exhibit a saintlike submissiveness

noun.description: An object or collection of objects on public display in an art gallery or museum or at a trade fair.
examples: the museum is rich in exhibits

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense submit for consideration, also present a document as evidence in court): from Latin exhibit- held out, from the verb exhibere, from ex- out + habere hold.
